intro: Glaucium grenieranum, commonly known as the European whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, glaucous leaves and produces yellowish or greenish flowers with prominent stamens. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and wastelands. Its historical use in traditional medicine is noted, though it is now primarily of botanical interest.
